ContentOverview.ProblemStatement: Bike couriers often experience delays due to mechanical issues. This impacts delivery times and customer satisfaction. A lack of basic maintenance skills contributes to these issues. This training aims to address this gap.

TargetAudience.BulletItem: All bike couriers within the organization.
Assumed skill level: Basic bike operation knowledge.

InstructionalMethods.BulletItem: Computer-Based Training (CBT): Interactive modules with visuals, animations, and knowledge checks.
Hands-on Practice: Practical exercises where couriers apply what they've learned on actual bikes.
Demonstrations: Instructors will demonstrate key procedures.
Q&A Sessions: Opportunities for couriers to ask questions and receive clarification.

FormativeEvaluation.BulletItem: Surveys: Collect feedback on the training content and delivery methods.

SummativeEvaluation.BulletItem: Surveys: Assess knowledge gained and confidence in performing maintenance tasks.
Assessment Results: Evaluate performance on hands-on exercises.

PerformanceMetrics.BulletItem: Monitor improvement in on-time delivery rates.

Phase.BulletItem: Conduct a pilot training session with a small group of couriers.
Gather feedback and make necessary revisions.
Track performance metrics and gather feedback to continuously improve the training program.

TechnicalRequirements.BulletItem: Players/Plug-ins: Adobe Flash Player, Adobe Acrobat Reader.
File Size: Optimized to minimize download times (under 100KB per file where possible).

LearningPlan.InterventionImplementation: The intervention will be implemented through the creation and delivery of the combined CBT and hands-on training program.
LearningPlan.PerformanceEvaluation: The effectiveness of the training will be evaluated using formative surveys, summative surveys, and analysis of performance metrics.
